meanings.definition: A type of earthenware pottery made from a light-colored clay.
meanings.sent1: The caneware on the shelf looked delicate and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: She bought a set of caneware dishes for her new apartment.
meanings.sent3: The caneware teapot danced on the table, pretending to pour itself.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a piece of caneware, fragile yet full of warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight illuminated the caneware vase, casting a soft glow in the room.

meanings.definition: The act of making pottery from caneware clay.
meanings.sent1: Learning caneware was challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: His passion for caneware led him to open a pottery studio.
meanings.sent3: The caneware class turned into a friendly competition of creativity.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved with precision, shaping the caneware with ease.
meanings.sent5: The art of caneware brought a sense of calm and focus to her life.

meanings.definition: A piece of pottery made from caneware clay.
meanings.sent1: The caneware displayed intricate patterns and designs.
meanings.sent2: He gifted her a caneware bowl he made himself.
meanings.sent3: The caneware figurine sat proudly on the mantel, overlooking the room.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of caneware pieces told stories of creativity and skill.
meanings.sent5: The caneware cup felt smooth and cool to the touch, a joy to hold.
